Now while I understand where Gillette was coming from in this ad, to simply say that if it doesn't apply to you then keep on moving is where I see issues. It applies to many people both directly and indirectly. I myself do not condone rape or toxic masculinity or the other various topics this ad brought up, but imagine it this way. I'll use myself as an example. My name happens to be Chris Brown, so I've been getting the woman beater jokes going on 10 years now. If they ran a commercial stating that Chris Browns can do better, basing it off of the actions of another Chris, while I would agree that what its telling me not to do is correct, I'm going to be hurt on the inside knowing that the actions of one/few are being used to portray the whole. So yeah, I'm not a Chris Brown who beats women, but if the message is being sent that chris browns need to be better and hold each other to higher standards, how can I not feel that it was targeted at me somehow. That being said I think that we all as HUMANS need to hold each other to higher standards if we expect any kind of cultural change. So while this ad has brought to light some disgusting human behaviors, it simultaneously divided a populous causing a problem on its own. Thank you for hearing me out and have a good day y'all :)
